query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Noi eravamo al sommo de la scala, 2 dove secondamente si risega 3 lo monte che salendo altrui dismala.
query.error: **English:** 1 We were at the top of the staircase, 2 where the mountain that makes people weary as they climb 3 rises up a second time.
query.result: 1 Nyns esa ni war an ben uhella’n seyl, 2 le mayth an menydh a wra’n ow pandra war 3 a wra’n owth owth ow kolla ow vagas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Ivi così una cornice lega 5 dintorno il poggio, come la primaia; 6 se non che l’arco suo più tosto piega.
query.error: **English:** 4 There a ledge encircles 5 the hill, just like the first one; 6 except that its arc curves more quickly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Ombra non lì è né segno che si paia: 8 parsi la ripa e parsi la via schietta 9 col livido color de la petraia.
query.error: **English:** 7 There is no shade there, nor any sign that pairs with it: 8 the bank and the straight path appear 9 with the livid color of the rock.
query.result: 7 Omber nyns yw eno sin ow parya: 8 parsys an ripa ha'n fordh schietta 9 gans an livido liv an petraya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 «Se qui per dimandar gente s’aspetta», 11 ragionava il poeta, «io temo forse 12 che troppo avrà d’indugio nostra eletta».
query.error: **English:** 10 "If people are expected here to ask," 11 the poet reasoned, "I fear perhaps 12 that our choice will have too much delay."
query.result: 10 "Ma'th omma rag aswonnys gen, 11 a resonya an bardh, "me a omdhueth marow, 12 ow thueth dhe bys vy dhe nestra dewisyans."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Poi fisamente al sole li occhi porse; 14 fece del destro lato a muover centro, 15 e la sinistra parte di sé torse.
query.error: **English:** 13 Then he fixed his eyes intently on the sun; 14 he made the center of his movement on the right side, 15 and turned the left part of himself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 «O dolce lume a cui fidanza i’ entro 17 per lo novo cammin, tu ne conduci», 18 dicea, «come condur si vuol quinc’ entro.
query.error: **English:** 16 "O sweet light, in whom I trust 17 for the new path, you lead us," 18 he said, "as one must be led here within.
query.result: 16 "O golon golwg dhe'n fydh i'm boos, 17 rag an fordh nowydh, ty a'n gorra, 18 a leveris, "del a leverir omma omma."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Tu scaldi il mondo, tu sovr’ esso luci; 20 s’altra ragione in contrario non ponta, 21 esser dien sempre li tuoi raggi duci».
query.error: **English:** 19 You warm the world, you shine above it; 20 if another reason does not arise to the contrary, 21 your rays should always be our guides.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Quanto di qua per un migliaio si conta, 23 tanto di là eravam noi già iti, 24 con poco tempo, per la voglia pronta;
query.error: **English:** 22 As far as one counts a thousand steps from here, 23 so far had we already gone there, 24 in a short time, because of our eager desire;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 e verso noi volar furon sentiti, 26 non però visti, spiriti parlando 27 a la mensa d’amor cortesi inviti.
query.error: **English:** 25 and toward us were heard flying, 26 but not seen, spirits speaking 27 courteous invitations to the table of love.
query.result: 25 ha dhe'n fordh omma a glewys omma hedhi, 26 mes nyns omma gwelys, speris ow kewsel 27 dhe'n fordh dhe'n boordh a garow karanteth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 La prima voce che passò volando 29 ‘Vinum non habent’ altamente disse, 30 e dietro a noi l’andò reïterando.
query.error: **English:** 28 The first voice that passed by flying 29 said loudly, "They have no wine," 30 and behind us it went repeating it.
query.result: 28 An kynsa lef a drehedha hedhi 29 'Vinum non habent' a leveris uhel, 30 ha wosa henna a'n drehedha ow adrohedhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 E prima che del tutto non si udisse 32 per allungarsi, un’altra ‘I’ sono Oreste’ 33 passò gridando, e anco non s’affisse.
query.error: **English:** 31 And before it was completely unheard 32 because of the distance, another, "I am Orestes," 33 passed by shouting, and did not stop either.
query.result: 31 Ha kyns na veu klevys dhe bys vyth 32 rag an pella, arall 'Me yw Orestes' 33 a drehedha ow gridi, ha nyns esa dhe bys vyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 «Oh!», diss’ io, «padre, che voci son queste?». 35 E com’ io domandai, ecco la terza 36 dicendo: ‘Amate da cui male aveste’.
query.error: **English:** 34 "Oh!" I said, "father, what voices are these?" 35 And as I asked, behold the third 36 saying: "Loved by the one from whom you had harm."
query.result: 34 "Oh!", me a leveris, "tas, pyth leveryow yw henna?" 35 Ha del vreuson me, wela an nessa 36 ow leverel: 'Karys gans an neb a'th wrug kamm'.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 E ’l buon maestro: «Questo cinghio sferza 38 la colpa de la invidia, e però sono 39 tratte d’amor le corde de la ferza.
query.error: **English:** 37 And the good master: "This circle scourges 38 the sin of envy, and therefore 39 the cords of the whip are drawn from love.
query.result: 37 Ha'n mester da: "An keth ma a skourj 38 an pechod a'n gonolgow, ha dre henna 39 an korden a'n ferja yw gwres gans karanteth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Lo fren vuol esser del contrario suono; 41 credo che l’udirai, per mio avviso, 42 prima che giunghi al passo del perdono.
query.error: **English:** 40 The rein wants to be of the opposite sound; 41 I believe that you will hear it, in my opinion, 42 before you reach the pass of forgiveness.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Ma ficca li occhi per l’aere ben fiso, 44 e vedrai gente innanzi a noi sedersi, 45 e ciascun è lungo la grotta assiso».
query.error: **English:** 43 But fix your eyes intently through the air, 44 and you will see people sitting down before us, 45 and each one is seated along the cave.
query.result: 43 Mes set thy'th sel an ayr yn fast, 44 ha gwelys pobel kyns honan ow tossedha, 45 ha pub onan ow tos owth an ogof».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Allora più che prima li occhi apersi; 47 guarda’mi innanzi, e vidi ombre con manti 48 al color de la pietra non diversi.
query.error: **English:** 46 Then I opened my eyes more than before; 47 I looked ahead, and I saw shades with cloaks 48 not different in color from the stone.
query.result: 46 Anedhenna moy es yger an sel, 47 gwelaf vy kyns, ha gwelys owdensow gans mantow 48 heb dhefredha dhe'n liw an men».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 E poi che fummo un poco più avanti, 50 udia gridar: ‘Maria, òra per noi’: 51 gridar ‘Michele’ e ‘Pietro’ e ‘Tutti santi’.
query.error: **English:** 49 And after we had gone a little further, 50 I heard them cry: ‘Mary, pray for us’: 51 they cried ‘Michael’ and ‘Peter’ and ‘All Saints’.
query.result: 49 Ha wosa veu un bythyn moy a-rag, 50 klewaf vy ow kewsel: ‘Mari, pedn dhymman’: 51 ow kewsel ‘Mikael’ ha ‘Peder’ ha ‘Pub Sansow’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Non credo che per terra vada ancoi 53 omo sì duro, che non fosse punto 54 per compassion di quel ch’i’ vidi poi;
query.error: **English:** 52 I do not believe that there goes on earth today 53 a man so hard, that he would not have been pricked 54 with pity for what I saw then;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 ché, quando fui sì presso di lor giunto, 56 che li atti loro a me venivan certi, 57 per li occhi fui di grave dolor munto.
query.error: **English:** 55 because, when I was so close to them, 56 that their actions became clear to me, 57 I was drained of heavy sorrow through my eyes.
query.result: 55 rag, pan veu vy ken ogas owth, 56 aga oberow dhe'm dhe'n veu kler dhe'm, 57 dre'm sel veu vy gwaynys gans dolor bras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Di vil ciliccio mi parean coperti, 59 e l’un sofferia l’altro con la spalla, 60 e tutti da la ripa eran sofferti.
query.error: **English:** 58 They seemed to me to be covered with vile haircloth, 59 and one suffered the other with his shoulder, 60 and all were supported by the bank.
query.result: 58 Gans vilik silik ow poyntsa ow tos kovrys, 59 ha'n o onan ow sogor an aral gans y skav, 60 ha pub onan ow sogor gans an glan.

query.prompt:

query.result: 61 Vel dhiso den dhe'n feth an golow, 62 a sew orth dhe'n pardonow rag gorra aga besow, 63 ha'n eyl a let aga benen war an eyl aral,

64 perché ’n altrui pietà tosto si pogna, 65 non pur per lo sonar de le parole, 66 ma per la vista che non meno agogna.

70 ché a tutti un fil di ferro i cigli fóra 71 e cusce sì, come a sparvier selvaggio 72 si fa però che queto non dimora.

query.result: 70 rag dreth omma houarn aga lagha 71 ha aga eskern, vel orth ysparfell gwyls, 72 rag henna a wra gwres dhe'n dhemedh.

73 A me pareva, andando, fare oltraggio, 74 veggendo altrui, non essendo veduto: 75 per ch’io mi volsi al mio consiglio saggio.
query.error: **English:** 73 To me it seemed, as I went, that I was doing wrong, 74 seeing others, and not being seen: 75 therefore I turned to my wise advisor.
query.result: 73 Dhym vyth teves, ow tos, ow tos anwonvos, 74 ow tos ow kul owth, heb bos gweles: 75 rag henna a wra owth dhe'n kynsler fur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Ben sapev’ ei che volea dir lo muto; 77 e però non attese mia dimanda, 78 ma disse: «Parla, e sie breve e arguto».

query.result: 76 Ytho ef a wydhvos pyth a vynsi an mud, 77 ha rag henna nyns o let vy'm gorra, 78 mes leverel: “Kowsel, ha bos byr ha kler”.

query.prompt:

94 «O frate mio, ciascuna è cittadina 95 d’una vera città; ma tu vuo’ dire 96 che vivesse in Italia peregrina».

query.result: 94 "O froder vy, pub onan yw kethres 95 a'n cita whyr; mes a vynna leverel 96 ow a veu byw yn Itali avel pilgrim."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Questo mi parve per risposta udire 98 più innanzi alquanto che là dov’ io stava, 99 ond’ io mi feci ancor più là sentire.
query.error: **English:** 97 This seemed to me to be the answer 98 a little further on from where I was standing, 99 so I made myself heard even further.
query.result: 97 Henwynas dhe'm ow klevys henna 98 moyha pella a'm beu ages le may fe, 99 rag henna y'm gwras vy dhe'm dhe'n klevys moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Tra l’altre vidi un’ombra ch’aspettava 101 in vista; e se volesse alcun dir ‘Come?’, 102 lo mento a guisa d’orbo in sù levava.
query.error: **English:** 100 Among the others I saw a shade who was waiting 101 attentively; and if anyone wanted to say 'How?', 102 he would raise his chin upwards like a blind man.
query.result: 100 Ynter ombroes erel y'm gwelas onan 101 ow tos yn eghen; ha mar via neb leverel 'Pyth?', 102 ev a via dhe'n varv dhe'n ughel avel den dall.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 «Spirto», diss’ io, «che per salir ti dome, 104 se tu se’ quelli che mi rispondesti, 105 fammiti conto o per luogo o per nome».
query.error: **English:** 103 "Spirit," I said, "who humbles yourself in order to ascend, 104 if you are the one who answered me, 105 tell me about yourself, either by place or by name."
query.result: 103 "Eneval," leveris, "ow a-wul dhe'n ughel, 104 mar ty hwra henna ow a-wrug dhe'm leverel, 105 lever dhe'm a-dro dhe'n hys eghen po dhe'n hanow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 «Io fui sanese», rispuose, «e con questi 107 altri rimendo qui la vita ria, 108 lagrimando a colui che sé ne presti.
query.error: **English:** 106 "I was from Siena," he replied, "and with these 107 others I am here to atone for my wicked life, 108 weeping to Him who grants us His grace.
query.result: 106 "My a veu a Senis," ev a leveris, "ha gans an re 107 ombroes erel y'm ow tos ow kul an byw drog, 108 ow wheli dhe'n Nebes ow a-wra gras dhe'n ni."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Savia non fui, avvegna che Sapìa 110 fossi chiamata, e fui de li altrui danni 111 più lieta assai che di ventura mia.
query.error: **English:** 109 I was not wise, although I was called Sapìa, 110 and I took more pleasure in the misfortunes of others 111 than in my own good fortune.
query.result: 109 Nyns o'm doeth, byttegens o'm henwys Sapìa, 110 ha moy lies o'm beu yn an drogow erel 111 ages yn vy eghen gwynfortyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 E perché tu non creda ch’io t’inganni, 113 odi s’i’ fui, com’ io ti dico, folle, 114 già discendendo l’arco d’i miei anni.
query.error: **English:** 112 And so that you do not think that I am deceiving you, 113 listen to how foolish I was, as I tell you, 114 when I was already descending the arch of my years.
query.result: 112 Ha rag na vynnyth kredis ow'm beu ow tos ow t’inganni, 113 klev mar o'm beu, avel ow leveris dhe'th, fol, 114 pan o'm beu ow tiskenn an bwa a'm blydhennow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Eran li cittadin miei presso a Colle 116 in campo giunti co’ loro avversari, 117 e io pregava Iddio di quel ch’e’ volle.

query.result: 115 O'm kethres o veu ogas dhe Colle, 116 ow tos dhe'n fordh gans aga enebow, 117 ha my a veu ow pedhi dhe'n Nebes rag henna ow a veu ev ow tos.

query.result: 118 Torros oen ow hagos havalys dhe'n 119 kerdhes a-hedhi; ha gweles an helghi, 120 lowena a gemeras dhe bys vyth dhe'n,

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 tanto ch’io volsi in sù l’ardita faccia, 122 gridando a Dio: “Omai più non ti temo!”, 123 come fé ’l merlo per poca bonaccia.
query.error: **English:** 121 so much that I turned my bold face upward, 122 crying to God: “Now I fear you no more!”, 123 as the blackbird did for a little calm weather.
query.result: 121 kyn feth ow holan dhe'n dhe'n nef, 122 ow klewes dhe Dhew: “Nebes vyth owth a ofn!”, 123 kepar ha'n merlo rag termyn byghan a dheworth.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Pace volli con Dio in su lo stremo 125 de la mia vita; e ancor non sarebbe 126 lo mio dover per penitenza scemo,

query.result: 124 Hedha a vynnas gans Dhew dhe'n dhe'n diwedh 125 a'm byw; ha neb vyth ow dledir 126 ow fetha dhe'n gans pennans,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 se ciò non fosse, ch’a memoria m’ebbe 128 Pier Pettinaio in sue sante orazioni, 129 a cui di me per caritate increbbe.

query.prompt:

130 Ma tu chi se’, che nostre condizioni 131 vai dimandando, e porti li occhi sciolti, 132 sì com’ io credo, e spirando ragioni?».
query.error: **English:** 130 But who are you, who go asking about our conditions, 131 and wear your eyes unbound, 132 as I believe, and speak while breathing?».
query.result: 130 Mes ty pandra, pyw ow kondiſhons 131 owth a ow kovsel, ha porth dha lygaſow diwask, 132 kepar ha kovynnaf, ha owth a owth a ow reſon?».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 «Li occhi», diss’ io, «mi fieno ancor qui tolti, 134 ma picciol tempo, ché poca è l’offesa 135 fatta per esser con invidia vòlti.
query.error: **English:** 133 “My eyes,” I said, “will still be taken from me here, 134 but for a short time, for the offense 135 committed by turning them with envy is small.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Troppa è più la paura ond’ è sospesa 137 l’anima mia del tormento di sotto, 138 che già lo ’ncarco di là giù mi pesa».

query.result: 136 Re beu yw an ofn dre henna yw ow enef 137 owth a'n poen a-woles, 138 henna yw ow karga a-woles owth ow pos dhe'n karga a-woles.”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Ed ella a me: «Chi t’ha dunque condotto 140 qua sù tra noi, se giù ritornar credi?». 141 E io: «Costui ch’è meco e non fa motto.
query.error: **English:** 139 And she to me: “Who then has led you 140 up here among us, if you believe you will return below?”. 141 And I: “This one who is with me and does not speak.

query.prompt:

query.result: 142 Ha byw owth ow; ha dre henna ty a kovsel dhym, 143 speris dewisys, mar ty a vyn bos owth ow a remov 144 ow troesow mortal rag dhym dhe'n a-woles.”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 «Oh, questa è a udir sì cosa nuova», 146 rispuose, «che gran segno è che Dio t’ami; 147 però col priego tuo talor mi giova.

query.prompt:

148 E cheggioti, per quel che tu più brami, 149 se mai calchi la terra di Toscana, 150 che a’ miei propinqui tu ben mi rinfami.

query.result: 148 Ha owth ow a kovsel dhym, rag henna pyw ty a vyn moy, 149 mar ty a gamm dhe'n tir Toscani, 150 bos owth ow a dhemedh dhe'm kerensow ow enef da.”.

154 ma più vi perderanno li ammiragli».
